com.yantra.api.ysc.formatting

      org.w3c.dom.Document manageTransformationData(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageTransformationData API is used to create, modify, or delete Transformation Data and Locale specific data.

    • Method Detail

      • manageTransformationData

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageTransformationData(YFSEnvironment env,
                                              org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                       throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                              java.rmi.RemoteException

        The manageTransformationData API is used to create, modify, or delete Transformation Data and Locale specific data.

        This includes the ability to:

        • Create Configuration Data, Transformation Data and Locale specific Data based on the attributes provided in input XML.
        • Modify the Transformation Data and Locale specific data based on LocaleCode, OrganizationCode, DocumentType, TemplateCode and TemplateName in input XML.
        • Delete the Transformation Template for the specific Localecode.

        Mandatory Attributes in Input XML to Create and Modify:

        • TemplateCode, DocumentType, TransformationHeaderKey, (LocaleCode) or(Country and Language)
        • OR
        • TemplateCode,DocumentType,OrganizationCode,TemplateName,(LocaleCode) or(Country and Language)

        Mandatory Attributes in Input XML to Delete:

        • TemplateCode, DocumentType, TransformationHeaderKey
        • OR
        • TemplateCode,DocumentType,OrganizationCode,TemplateName
        • LocaleCode, if deleting the Locale Specific data

        where:

        • TemplateCode specifies the Template Code for the document type. E.g:Print Proposal.
        • DocumentType specifies the Document Type for the document. E.g: 0015(Quote).
        • OrganizationCode specifies the Organization Code of the Organization for which we need template.
        • TemplateName specifies the Template Name. E.g: Template for Government.
        • TransformationHeaderKey specifies the TransformationHeaderKey i.e Primary Key of YFS_Transformation_Header Table.
        • LocaleCode specifies the Locale Code. E.g:eu_US_EST.
        • Country specifies the country code. E.g: US
        • Language specifies the language code.Eg:en

        Tables Modified are: YFS_TRANSFORMATION_CONFIG, YFS_TRANSFORMATION_HEADER and YFS_TRANS_HEADER_LOCALE Tables.

        Input document(XML) being checked for DocumentType, TemplateCode and the corresponding TransformationConfigKey stamped in the input document. Now the mandatory Parameters are checked. If Country and Language are present it will process the Document as such, but if not present it will check the Localecode and fetch the corresponding Country, Language and Variant from YFS_LOCALE using getLocaleList and stamp it in Input document.

        NOTE:

        • This API is not Template controlled.
        • This API do not support managing multiple Header information.
        • This API do not support managing multiple Locale data for the specific Header information.
        Variant is not mandatory.

        Errors and Error Codes

        • YSC91B_012: Invalid Config Data, either DocumentType or TemplateCode attribute missing in Input XML.
        • YSC91B_013: TransformationHeaderLocaleList Element missing in the Input XML.
        • YFS10367: Invalid Document Type .(Not match with the entry in table YFS_Document_Params)
        • YFS10395: Invalid Organization Code .(Not match with the entry in table YFS_Organization)
        • YFS10364: Mandatory Parameters for the Operation are missing.
        • YFC0016: Invalid Operation.(This occurs when the operation other than Manage, Create, Delete is passed in the input XML)
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inDoc - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
